summary:
Do you know that leather is made from hides and skins that are mostly a by-product of the food industry? Leather making transforms the otherwise huge amounts of waste into beautiful and long-lasting functional materials. Many people work in the leather industry because their families have been doing for generations and I have seen them doing their work with a lot of emotions involved. Maybe this is a reason why I sometimes also feel natural materials such as wood or leather seem to carry emotions with them.
As a scientist in a Dutch family business and important international player in leather chemicals, I am currently leading the "Bio-Based" platform towards our innovation ambition in creating a more sustainable leather value chain. We are collaborating with companies at the frontier of the bio-based economy as well as universities and research institutes on innovation projects to develop new chemistries and products based on raw materials derived from biomass. I work closely not only with our product development team but also with our commercial team to translate the needs from the market into tangible products and approachable stories.
